thread.title: Jamaica's Marlon James wins Booker Prize for fiction
thread.title_full: Jamaica's Marlon James wins Booker Prize for fiction - KPTV - FOX 12

author: cbs8
title: Jamaica's Marlon James wins Booker Prize for fiction
text:
By JILL LAWLESS
Associated Press LONDON (AP) - Marlon James has won literature's Booker Prize with a vivid, violent, exuberant and expletive-laden novel based on the attempted assassination of Bob Marley. He is the first Jamaican writer to take the prestigious award.
The chairman of the judges, Michael Wood, said James' "A Brief History of Seven Killings" was full of the "sheer pleasure" of language.
James, 44, was awarded the 50,000 pound ($77,000) prize during a black-tie dinner at London's medieval Guildhall. Critics have compared his novel to the work of William Faulkner and Quentin Tarantino, while James himself has cited Charles Dickens as an influence.
James beat five other authors, including Americans Anne Tyler, for multigenerational family saga "A Spool of Blue Thread," and Hanya Yanagihara for "A Little Life," the story of four friends.
